concept.title: Submitting Data to
concept.shortdesc: Data can be submitted to PHEMI using a REST API, using FTP or SSH batch ingestion, or using ETL tools.

conbody.p: Data can be ingested and aggregated from multiple disparate sources, bringing together and consolidating data silos. Data can be imported in a variety of ways:

ul.li: Streaming—Machine-to-machine data collections, such as telemetry and hospital bedside monitors, can stream data to by means of the PHEMI .

li.p: Push—Data collections and extract, transform, and load (ETL) tools can publish to using either JDBC or the PHEMI .
Pull—Custom connectors based on the PHEMI can be deployed to allow to fetch data from sources.
Manually—Files can be manually uploaded to from a standard browser window.

Store by Reference and Action— can reference remote data or a remote dataset through a URL, stored procedure, SQL query, external table, or the . Applications can also be stored and executed, causing external tables or external data to be accessed and pre-processed.
